long_description: Hatha Yoga is a branch of yoga that emphasizes physical postures and alignment. It is suitable for all levels and focuses on slow-paced stretching, simple breathing exercises, and meditation.

Vinyasa Yoga involves synchronizing breath with a continuous flow of postures. This dynamic practice builds strength, flexibility, and mindfulness, providing a full-body workout and mental relaxation.
Ashtanga Yoga is a rigorous style of yoga that follows a specific sequence of postures and is linked by breath. It is designed to detoxify the body, build strength, and increase stamina.
Yin Yoga targets deep connective tissues and fascia, aiming to increase circulation in the joints and improve flexibility. Poses are held for longer periods, fostering a meditative state.

provide_description: Hot yoga with a set sequence.
long_description: Bikram Yoga consists of a set sequence of 26 postures and two breathing exercises practiced in a heated room. The heat helps to loosen muscles, enhance flexibility, and promote detoxification.
Restorative Yoga uses props to support the body in restful postures. It focuses on deep relaxation and stress relief, making it ideal for recovery and mental clarity.
